column4: Can anyone recommend an alternative to MS Exchange server? I need something that will do everything that exchange does.
For free?
try 'Zimbra'
Version 5.0 will have a plugin for Evolution, to allow transparent calendaring and address book access too.
Well preferably free. I noticed Zimbra but it cost a bit.
The open source edition is free - so you can at last try it out.
What will be the difference between the OS and Enterprise version? The support?
The Enterprise version has support and includes automagic backups and probably a few more things I on't know about.
I only have 2 mail accounts on it, so I don't think I have a need for the enterprise one :-)
However, mine does authenticate against an eternal LDAP server, which is also used for samba, pam_ldap and radius auth.
True, this is for a friend in enterprise level IT and I think he has been tasked with replacing Exchange and reducingg if not eliminating cost.
Enterprise level IT *needs* payware support, would be my guess. They could run a completely free system, but I doubt it's worth the risk to the organisation.
I'm not 100% sure, but there might als be an outlook connector in the non-free versions
So it would funtion as a drop-in replacement for exchange. of cours, it speaks webmail, pop and imap as well.
I agree and don't understand it myself. He just asked and said it had to replace exchange and operate with Outlook client
Sounds like what he's after then. probbaly somehting that doesn't cost as much per-seat as exchange does. There's another one too, but I forget its name...

zimbra looks to be the answer but it will cost $3700 I think for 1000 seats and $5800 for unlimited, which to me seams like a bargain. Don't know why they want to eliminate cost in an enterprise environment.
probably an idiot CIO ;-)
Still, I'm pretty sure unlimited Exchange costs a wee bit more than $5800
I think you are right but I looked at it earlier, could have been something else that said unlimited was just under 6k which could have been per year.
$4000 -> Enables creating up to 50 storage groups, with a maximum of 50 databases per Mailbox server role (whatever tf that is)
I just noticed a price of 20k per year but I think that was for unlimited support
